claim: User ID 13 received only 9 negative comments.
reasoning: The claim states User ID 13 received only 9 negative comments (Score < 60). Counting comments with Score < 60 on posts owned by User ID 13 yields 14, not 9. The alternative interpretation (comments where UserId = 13 with Score < 60) yields 25. Neither matches the claimed value of 9, so the claim is contradicted.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE comments
(
    Id              INTEGER          not null
        primary key,
    PostId          INTEGER          null,
    Score           INTEGER          null,
    Text            TEXT     null,
    CreationDate    DATETIME     null,
    UserId          INTEGER          null,
    UserDisplayName TEXT null,
        foreign key (PostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (UserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text: The claim is about "User ID 13 received negative comments." The hint says negative comments refer to `Score < 60`. I need to determine what "received" means - comments on posts owned by User ID 13. Let me query this.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM comments c JOIN posts p ON c.PostId = p.Id WHERE p.OwnerUserId = 13 AND c.Score < 60;"
input.description: Count negative comments (Score < 60) on posts owned by User ID 13

content.text: The query returns 14, but the claim says 9. Let me also check if "received" could mean comments where UserId = 13 (comments directed at or authored by user 13):

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM comments WHERE UserId = 13 AND Score < 60;"
input.description: Count negative comments authored by User ID 13

content.text:
Neither interpretation gives 9. The most natural interpretation of "received" is comments on posts owned by User ID 13, which yields 14 — not 9. The alternative (comments authored by User 13) gives 25. In either case, the claim of "only 9" is contradicted.

The alternative interpretation (comments where UserId = 13 with Score < 60) yields 25. Neither matches the claimed value of 9, so the claim is contradicted."}
